meaningMnemonic: Because the hiragana ends with an う sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>capsize</kanji> but the verb version is what happens when a plan or idea capsizes. It going <vocabulary>to be overturned</vocabulary>. It was a bad idea, go back, don't do it or we'll all sink!
readingMnemonic: Of all the ideas that need <vocabulary>to be overturned</vocabulary>, it's the ones from the <reading>靴 guy</reading> (くつがえ). He thinks we should only wear shoes. Not shoes and nothing else, but shoes all over our entire bodies. Yikes, now that's an idea I'd like <vocabulary>to be retracted</vocabulary>, 靴 guy.
